snippet: The city wanted to fire more than a dozen teachers accused of inappropriate behavior, but in most cases it has been overruled by an arbitrator who opted for a milder penalty.
abstract: New York City Education Dept releases records of 16 teachers, accused of inappropriate behavior with students, whose firings were overruled by an arbitrator; 14 of those 16 teachers are still teaching and in contact with students; subject of inappropriate behavior by city teachers is a pressing issue, and Schools Chancellor Dennis W Walcott has ordered a review of all substantiated cases of misconduct.

byline.original: By DAVID W. CHEN and PATRICK McGEEHAN

lead_paragraph: The city wanted to fire more than a dozen teachers accused of inappropriate behavior, but in most cases it has been overruled by an arbitrator who opted for a milder penalty.

headline.seo: Found to Have Misbehaved, but Still Teaching in New York City
headline.main: Found to Have Misbehaved With Pupils, but Still Teaching
headline.print_headline: Found to Have Misbehaved With Pupils, but Still Teaching
